CatDescriptText: William A. Smith, 1523 Beechview Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 8, 1959, pg. B1 with question: "Do you believe the John James Racket Squad is driving the numbers racket out of Pittsburgh?" answer reads: "I don't think that they are driving them out, but they are keeping them busy. As long as peopole will play the numbers, otheres will take the chances of operating lotteries.  The raids keep in the minds of people the fact that numbers playing is illegal."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of William A. Smith wearing eyeglasses and plaid short sleeved shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
